title: India Might Send A Second String Team To Pakistan For Davis Cup Tie To Avoid Suspension
text:
India Might Send A Second String Team To Pakistan For Davis Cup Tie To Avoid Suspension

India Might Send A Second String Team To Pakistan For Davis Cup Tie To Avoid Suspension

As the impasse continues over the decision whether to send the team for Davis Cup tie to Pakistan, All India Tennis Association has started the process to procure Pakistan Visas for players and support staff.

AFP

It is also an indication that the association might send a team to Pakistan for next month's tie in case the International Tennis Federation rejects its request to shift the matches to a neutral venue.

The AITA has also made it clear to the players that it won't force anyone to travel to Pakistan, and it will leave them to decide for themselves. In the case players opt out of the travelling party, AITA plans to send a second string team to avoid suspension, relegation and fine by ITF.

PTI

The tie which was scheduled to take place in Islamabad on September 14-15 but was postponed to November 29-30 by the ITF after security review.

AITA's office bearers assembled on Tuesday at the DLTA for a meeting, also attended by Bhupathi, and decided to at least start the visa process and keep pushing for a neutral venue.

"We are waiting for a final decision from the ITF and accordingly will take a call but as of now we have to start the visa process," AITA Secretary General Hironmoy Chatterjee told PTI.

AFP

The ITF, in its most recent reply, has conveyed to the AITA that the Davis Cup Committee will make a decision only after the security agencies file a report early next month.

ITF seems convinced, as of now, about the security situation in Pakistan after the Sri Lankan cricket team's tour of the country.

As the deliberations continue, the question marks remain over the India's participation and it will only become clearer in the next few weeks.

(With Inputs From PTI)
